MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void ContinueAsNew (object input);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ContinueAsNew(object input) cil managed
Public MustOverride Sub ContinueAsNew (input As Object)
abstract member ContinueAsNew : obj -> unit

Docs.param: The JSON-serializeable data to re-initialize the instance with.
Docs.summary: Restarts the orchestration by clearing its history.

remarks.para: Large orchestration histories can consume a lot of memory and cause delays in instance load times. This method can be used to periodically truncate the stored history of an orchestration instance.
Note that any unprocessed external events will be discarded when an orchestration instance restarts itself using this method.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void ContinueAsNew (object input, bool preserveUnprocessedEvents);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ContinueAsNew(object input, bool preserveUnprocessedEvents) cil managed
Public Overridable Sub ContinueAsNew (input As Object, preserveUnprocessedEvents As Boolean)
abstract member ContinueAsNew : obj * bool -> unit override this.ContinueAsNew : obj * bool -> unit

Docs.param: The JSON-serializeable data to re-initialize the instance with.

If set to true, re-adds any unprocessed external events into the new execution history when the orchestration instance restarts. If false, any unprocessed external events will be discarded when the orchestration instance restarts.
Docs.summary: Restarts the orchestration by clearing its history.

remarks.para: Large orchestration histories can consume a lot of memory and cause delays in instance load times. This method can be used to periodically truncate the stored history of an orchestration instance.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Threading.Tasks.Task CreateTimer (DateTime fireAt, System.Threading.CancellationToken cancelToken);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task CreateTimer(valuetype System.DateTime fireAt, valuetype System.Threading.CancellationToken cancelToken) cil managed
Public Overridable Function CreateTimer (fireAt As DateTime, cancelToken As CancellationToken) As Task

abstract member CreateTimer : DateTime * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task override this.CreateTimer : DateTime * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task

Docs.param: The time at which the timer should expire.
The CancellationToken to use for cancelling the timer.
Docs.summary: Creates a durable timer that expires at a specified time.
Docs.returns: A durable task that completes when the durable timer expires.
Docs.remarks: All durable timers created using this method must either expire or be cancelled using the before the orchestrator function completes. Otherwise the underlying framework will keep the instance alive until the timer expires.

Docs.returns: A durable task that completes when the durable timer expires.
Docs.remarks: All durable timers created using this method must either expire or be cancelled using the before the orchestrator function completes. Otherwise the underlying framework will keep the instance alive until the timer expires.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract DateTime CurrentUtcDateTime { get; }
.property instance valuetype System.DateTime CurrentUtcDateTime
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property CurrentUtcDateTime As DateTime
member this.CurrentUtcDateTime : DateTime

Docs.summary: Gets the current date/time in a way that is safe for use by orchestrator functions.
Docs.value: The orchestration's current date/time in UTC.
Docs.remarks: This date/time value is derived from the orchestration history. It always returns the same value at specific points in the orchestrator function code, making it deterministic and safe for replay.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract T GetInput<T> ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance !!T GetInput<T>() cil managed
Public MustOverride Function GetInput(Of T) () As T
abstract member GetInput : unit -> 'T

Docs.typeparam: Any data contract type that matches the JSON input.
Docs.summary: Gets the input of the current orchestrator function as a deserialized value.
Docs.returns: The deserialized input value.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string InstanceId { get; }
.property instance string InstanceId
Public Overridable ReadOnly Property InstanceId As String
member this.InstanceId : string

Docs.summary: Gets the instance ID of the currently executing orchestration.
Docs.value: The ID of the current orchestration instance.
Docs.remarks: The instance ID is generated and fixed when the orchestrator function is scheduled. It can be either auto-generated, in which case it is formatted as a GUID, or it can be user-specified with any format.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsReplaying { get; }
.property instance bool IsReplaying
Public Overridable ReadOnly Property IsReplaying As Boolean
member this.IsReplaying : bool

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the orchestrator function is currently replaying itself.
Docs.value: true if the orchestrator function is currently being replayed; otherwise false.
Docs.remarks: This property is useful when there is logic that needs to run only when the orchestrator function is *not* replaying. For example, certain types of application logging may become too noisy when duplicated as part of orchestrator function replay. The orchestrator code could check to see whether the function is being replayed and then issue the log statements when this value is false.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract Guid NewGuid ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.Guid NewGuid() cil managed
Public MustOverride Function NewGuid () As Guid
abstract member NewGuid : unit -> Guid

Docs.summary: Creates a new GUID that is safe for replay within an orchestrator function.
Docs.returns: The new value.
Docs.remarks: The default implementation of this method creates a name-based UUID using the algorithm from RFC 4122 4.3. The name input used to generate this value is a combination of the orchestration instance ID and an internally managed sequence number.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string ParentInstanceId { get; }
.property instance string ParentInstanceId
Public Overridable ReadOnly Property ParentInstanceId As String
member this.ParentInstanceId : string

Docs.summary: Gets the parent instance ID of the currently executing sub-orchestration.
Docs.value: The ID of the parent orchestration of the current sub-orchestration instance. The value will be available only in sub-orchestrations.
Docs.remarks: The parent instance ID is generated and fixed when the parent orchestrator function is scheduled. It can be either auto-generated, in which case it is formatted as a GUID, or it can be user-specified with any format.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract void SetCustomStatus (object customStatusObject);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetCustomStatus(object customStatusObject) cil managed
Public MustOverride Sub SetCustomStatus (customStatusObject As Object)
abstract member SetCustomStatus : obj -> unit

Docs.param: The JSON-serializeable value to use as the orchestrator function's custom status.
Docs.summary: Sets the JSON-serializeable status of the current orchestrator function.
Docs.remarks: The value is serialized to JSON and will be made available to the orchestration status query APIs. The serialized JSON value must not exceed 16 KB of UTF-16 encoded text.

Docs.param: The name of the event to wait for.
Docs.summary: Waits asynchronously for an event to be raised with name .
Docs.returns: A durable task that completes when the external event is received.
Docs.remarks: External clients can raise events to a waiting orchestration instance using with the object parameter set to null.
